content: mark the 1st and 4th stitches 6 fig 13 from here on continue without counting remember to work in blo remove marker work 3 single_crochet in the stitch and put the marker in the middle single_crochet single_crochet in each st until you reach to the next marked stitch fig 14-15 a free pattern by kati gálusz ravelry // etsy // lovecrafts please don t hesitate to contact me lunacollie@gmail com or via ravelry or etsy if you have any problem following the pattern or notice a mistake or just to show me your creation 8 repeat the instructions in brackets until the piece is big enough to cover the body from ears to just behind the rear legs fig 16 it won t take many repeats so check the fit often when you reach this size remove the marker from the next st slip_stitch in it and fasten_off the side where you fastened off should go to the bottom of the hedgehog the side with the other marker to the head remove that marker too and pin the spine coat to the body it is quite stretchy so you can gently tug on it to adjust the fit you will probably want to pull it lower at the shoulders it also helps to smooth fabric forward from the rear fig 17 use thread and a small needle to sew the spine coat to the body fig 18 free trapped lashes with a bristle brush or by raking through the fur with a yarn needle since these babies are so tiny the lashes will look rather long it helps if you trim them shorter around the head so they don t lean over the eyes of course you can give a full body trim as well if you want but clearing out the face usually does the trick fig 19-20 a free pattern by kati gálusz ravelry // etsy // lovecrafts please don t hesitate to contact me lunacollie@gmail com or via ravelry or etsy if you have any problem following the pattern or notice a mistake or just to show me your creation baby hedgehog - appendix text-only instructions for easy printing 9 head and body round 1 with plain yarn make a magic_ring single_crochet 6 and pull the ring closed 6 round 2 increase single_crochet 5 7 round 3 single_crochet in each st 7 round 4 single_crochet increase 3 single_crochet 3 10 take a 15-20cm/6-8 length of scrap yarn and pull one end through the 3rd st of round 4 the other end through the 7th - this will show the placement of the eyes fig 1 round 5 increase single_crochet 4 2 times 12 round 6 single_crochet 3 increase to make the ear chain 2 increase in the second chain from hook fig 2 continue into the st of round 5 single_crochet 3 increase to make the second ear chain 2 increase in the second chain from hook continue into the st of round 5 single_crochet 3 increase
